1.name: Citizen Kane
1.description: Following the death of publishing tycoon, Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance; 'Rosebud'.

2.name: Dumbo
2.description: Ridiculed because of his enormous ears, a young circus elephant is assisted by a mouse to achieve his full potential.

3.name: The Maltese Falcon
3.description: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

4.name: High Sierra
4.description: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

5.name: Adventures of Captain Marvel
5.description: To protect a magic talisman from being used for evil, a teenage boy named Billy Batson is given the power to become an adult superhero, Captain Marvel, with a single magic word: "Shazam!"

6.name: Unholy Partners
6.description: A tough, ambitious newspaperman starts a new tabloid in 1919 New York, with a crooked big-time gambler as a partner.

7.name: Belle Starr
7.description: At the end of the Civil War, an embittered Southern belle joins forces with a Confederate guerrilla leader to raid Union towns.

8.name: Suspicion
8.description: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, and soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

9.name: I Wake Up Screaming
9.description: Why is Inspector Ed Cornell trying to railroad Frankie Christopher for the murder of model Vicky Lynn?

10.name: Sergeant York
10.description: A marksman is drafted in World War I and ends up becoming one of the most celebrated war heroes.

11.name: How Green Was My Valley
11.description: At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans, he stern, she gentle, raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life.

12.name: Sullivan's Travels
12.description: A director of escapist films goes on the road as a hobo to learn about life, which gives him a rude awakening.

13.name: The Wolf Man
13.description: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him can not possibly exist.

14.name: Penny Serenade
14.description: A couple's big dreams give way to a life full of unexpected sadness and unexpected joy.

15.name: Ziegfeld Girl
15.description: Discovery by Flo Ziegfeld changes a girl's life but not necessarily for the better, as three beautiful women find out when they join the spectacle on Broadway: Susan, the singer who must ...                See full summary »

16.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
16.description: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

17.name: The Little Foxes
17.description: The ruthless, moneyed Hubbard clan lives in, and poisons, their part of the deep South at the turn of the twentieth century.

18.name: Ball of Fire
18.description: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mob boss lover.

19.name: The Lady Eve
19.description: A trio of classy card sharks targets the socially awkward heir to brewery millions for his money, until one of them falls in love with him.

20.name: Blood and Sand
20.description: Illiterate peasant Juan Gallardo rises meteorically to fame and fortune in the bullfight arena only to sow the seeds of his own fall.

21.name: 49th Parallel
21.description: A World War II U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada. To avoid internment, they must make their way to the border and get into the still-neutral U.S.

22.name: Meet John Doe
22.description: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

23.name: They Died with Their Boots On
23.description: A highly fictionalized account of the life of George Armstrong Custer from his arrival at West Point in 1857 to his death at the battle of the Little Big Horn in 1876.

24.name: Hold Back the Dawn
24.description: Stopped in Mexico by U.S. Immigration, Georges Iscovescu hopes to get into the country by marrying a citizen.

25.name: Genroku Chûshingura
25.description: In 1701, Lord Takuminokami Asano has a feud with Lord Kira and he tries to kill Kira in the corridors of the Shogun's palace. The Shogun sentences Lord Asano to commit suppuku and deprives ...                See full summary »

26.name: Tobacco Road
26.description: Hillbilly family life in 1941 rural Georgia.

27.name: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
27.description: A couple who have been married for three years are shocked to learn that their marriage is not legally valid.

28.name: A Woman's Face
28.description: A female blackmailer with a disfiguring facial scar meets a plastic surgeon who offers her the possibility of looking like a normal woman.

29.name: That Hamilton Woman
29.description: The story of courtesan and dance-hall girl Emma Hamilton, including her relationships with Sir William Hamilton and Admiral Horatio Nelson and her rise and fall, set during the Napoleonic Wars.

30.name: The Strawberry Blonde
30.description: Quick-tempered yet likable Biff Grimes falls for the beautiful Virginia Brush, but he is not the only young man in the neighborhood who is smitten with her.

31.name: The Great Lie
31.description: After a newlywed's husband apparently dies in a plane crash, she discovers that her rival for his affections is now pregnant with his child.

32.name: All That Money Can Buy
32.description: A nineteenth-century New Hampshire farmer who makes a pact with Satan for economic success enlists Daniel Webster to extract him from his contract.

33.name: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
33.description: Boxer Joe Pendleton dies 50 years too soon due to a heavenly mistake, and is given a new life as a millionaire playboy.

34.name: The Reluctant Dragon
34.description: Humorist Robert Benchley learns about the animation process at Walt Disney Studios while trying to find the great man himself to pitch him the idea of making a cartoon about a shy dragon.

35.name: Johnny Eager
35.description: The daughter of a district attorney falls in love with a gangster who her father is trying to have imprisoned.

36.name: Hold That Ghost
36.description: After inheriting a fortune from a gangster, two dim-witted service station attendants find themselves stranded in a haunted house.

37.name: Topper Returns
37.description: A fun-loving young woman finds herself murdered after trading bedrooms with her wealthy friend. Her ghost seeks aid from a banker to find out why and by whom.

38.name: Hellzapoppin'
38.description: Olsen and Johnson, a pair of stage comedians, try to turn their play into a movie and bring together a young couple in love, while breaking the fourth wall every step of the way.

39.name: Two-Faced Woman
39.description: After a ski instructor catches her husband flirting with an old flame, she decides to pose as her (fictitious) twin sister in an attempt to keep him faithful.

40.name: Freedom Radio
40.description: Hitler's doctor is gradually realising that the Nazi regime isn't as good as it pretends to be when his friends start to "disappear" into the camps. His wife is courted by the party and ...                See full summary »

41.name: Shadow of the Thin Man
41.description: Nick and Nora are at their wisecracking best as they investigate murder and racketeering at a local race track.

42.name: Law of the Range
42.description: The Wolverine Kid kills a man and it looks like Steve Howard did it. But Steve's father recognizes the bullet as coming from the gun owned by the Kid. The Kid and Steve each have one of the...                See full summary »

43.name: Pot o' Gold
43.description: Jimmy, the owner of a failed music shop, goes to work with his uncle, the owner of a food factory. Before he gets there, he befriends an Irish family who happens to be his uncle's worst ...                See full summary »

44.name: 'Pimpernel' Smith
44.description: Professor Horatio Smith, while seeming very unassuming, rescues victims of Nazi persecution during World War II.

45.name: Love on the Dole
45.description: During the depression in England, a young lady from Lancashire decides to be a rich bookmaker's mistress, just to help the rest of her family who are unemployed.

46.name: The Shepherd of the Hills
46.description: A mysterious stranger arrives in the Missouri hills and befriends a young backwoods girl. Much to the dislike of her moonshiner fiancé who has vowed to find and kill his own father.

47.name: Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
47.description: Fields wants to sell a film story to Esoteric Studios. On the way he gets insulted by little boys, beat up for ogling a woman, and abused by a waitress. He becomes his niece's guardian when...                See full summary »

48.name: Footsteps in the Dark
48.description: A respected investment advisor has a double life as a mystery writer and becomes involved in the real murder of a shady client.

49.name: The Ghost Train
49.description: High jinks and chills ensue when a group of people become stranded at an isolated station and a legendary phantom train approaches.

50.name: Man Hunt
50.description: British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gun sight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.
